meanings.sent1: The sky turned palish as the sun began to set.
meanings.sent2: Her palish complexion made her look tired.
meanings.sent3: The palish walls of the old house gave it a ghostly appearance.
meanings.sent4: The palish moon cast a soft glow over the dark forest.
meanings.sent5: The palish flowers in the garden looked delicate and ethereal.

meanings.definition: To become somewhat pale in color.
meanings.sent1: She palished when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent2: His face palished as he realized he had forgotten his homework.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the spider made her palish with fear.
meanings.sent4: The room palished as the storm clouds blocked out the sun.
meanings.sent5: The painting palished over time, losing its vibrant colors.
